p: For each sample, 100 μg of protein was dissolved in 100 μL TEAB dissolution buffer and then diluted with 500 μL (50 mM) NH 4HCO 3. After the reduction of disulfides and alkylation, 2 μg trypsin was added and then incubated overnight at 37 °C for protein digestion. An equal volume of 0.1% FA was then added for acidizing. Peptides were purified on the Strata-X C18 pillar, which was first activated with methanol and then balanced by adding 1 mL 0.1% FA for three times, washed with 0.1% FA + 5% ACN twice, and eluted with 1 ml 0.1% FA + 80% ACN. Eluted peptides were then dried with a vacuum concentration meter. The dried peptide powder was re-dissolved with 20 μL (0.5 M) TEAB for peptide labelling.
